Sources of noise

NoiseSource class

class Sandbox_V1_4.NoiseSource[source]

The abstract superclass for all classes representing sources of noise.

__init__()[source]

Initialise NoiseSource.

get_data() → Dict[str, List[float]][source]

Get the noise source’s data.

Returns:

The noise source’s data.

Return type:

dict of data, which only includes the history of noise outputs in this superclass.

reset() → None[source]

Reset NoiseSource, by resetting noise level to 0 and deleting any existing history of noise outputs.

step(dt: float) → float[source]

Step the noise source forwards in time, and generate a noise output.

Parameters:

dt (float) – Interval of time to integrate the noise source over - not currently used.

Returns:

The noise source’s output.

Return type:

float

WhiteNoiseSource class

class Sandbox_V1_4.WhiteNoiseSource(min_val: float, max_val: float)[source]

A class representing a source of white noise. In every simulation step, the noise source outputs a random value drawn from a uniform distribution, the limits of which are set when the noise source is constructed.

__init__(min_val, max_val)[source]

Construct instance of WhiteNoiseSource. The noise generated by the noisesource will lie between min_val and max_val.

Parameters:

  • min_val (float) – The minimum value of the noise that this source will output.

  • max_val (float) – The maximum value of the noise that this source will output.

step(dt: float) → float[source]

Step noise source forwards in time. For this class, all that involves is generating a new output value and updating its history.

Parameters:

dt (float) – Interval of time to integrate the noise source over - not currently used.

Returns:

Output from noise source.

Return type:

float

BrownNoiseSource class

class Sandbox_V1_4.BrownNoiseSource(max_step_size: float)[source]

A class representing a source of brown noise, (e.g. a random walk like brownian motion). Technically, brown noise is the integral of white noise, so in each simulation step white noise is generated and then added to the noise level from the previous simulation step. This results in a drifting noise level.

__init__(max_step_size)[source]

Construct instance of BrownNoiseSource.

Parameters:

max_step_size (float) – The maximum distance that the output of the BrownNoiseSource will move by in a single simulation step.

step(dt: float) → float[source]

Step noise source forwards in time. For this class, all that involves is generating a new output value and updating its history.

Parameters:

dt (float) – Interval of time to integrate the noise source over - not currently used.

Returns:

Output from noise source.

Return type:

float

SpikeNoiseSource class

class Sandbox_V1_4.SpikeNoiseSource(prob: float, pos_size: float, neg_size: float)[source]

A class representing a source of “spike” noise.

__init__(prob, pos_size, neg_size)[source]

Construct a spike noise source. The sizes of positive and negative spikes are controlled independently. If you don’t want to use either positive or negative spikes, just set the corresponding parameter to 0, but note that you might want to double the spike probability parameter to compensate for half of the spikes (on average) being 0.

Parameters:

  • prob (float) – The probability of a spike being emitted. When a spike is output, it will be either positive or negative with equal probability.

  • pos_size (float) – The size of a positive spike.

  • neg_size (float) – The size of a negative spike.

set_params(params: List[float]) → None[source]

A method for setting the noise source’s parameters.

Parameters:

params (list(float)) – The noise source’s parameters, in the form [prob, pos_size, neg_size]

step(dt: float) → float[source]

Step noise source forwards in time. For this class, all that involves is generating a new output value and updating its history.

Parameters:

dt (float) – Interval of time to integrate the noise source over - not currently used.

Returns:

Output from noise source.

Return type:

float

class Sandbox_V1_4.GaussianNoiseSource(mean: float, std: float)[source]

A class representing a source of gaussian noise.

Construct instance of GaussianNoiseSource.

  • std (float) – The standard deviation of the nosie source.

step(dt: float) → float[source]

Step noise source forwards in time. For this class, all that involves is generating a new output value and updating its history.

Parameters:

dt (float) – Interval of time to integrate the noise source over - not currently used.

Return type:

float

NoiseMaker class

class Sandbox_V1_4.NoiseMaker(white_noise_params: List[float] = [0.0, 0.0], brown_noise_step: float = 0, spike_noise_params: List[float] = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0])[source]

A subclass of NoiseSource which provides a source of mixed noise: white, brown and “spike”. A NoiseMaker has its own instances of WhiteNoiseSource, BrownNoiseSource and SpikeNoiseSource, and its output is the sum of their outputs.

__init__(white_noise_params: List[float] = [0.0, 0.0], brown_noise_step: float = 0, spike_noise_params: List[float] = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0])[source]

Construct NoiseMaker. The noisemaker’s individual noise sources will only be constructed if non-zero parameters for them are passed into __init__. The NoiseMaker class does not provide for this to be changed after construction, although additional noise sources can always be added to a noisemaker’s list manually.

Parameters:

  • white_noise_params (list(float)) – Parameters for the noisemaker’s WhiteNoiseSource. Defaults to [0, 0], in which case the noisemaker will produce no white noise.

  • brown_noise_step (float) – The maximum step size for the noisemaker’s :class`BrownNoiseSource`. Defaults to 0, in which case the noisemaker will produce no brown nosie.

  • spike_noise_params (list(float)) – The parameters for the noisemaker’s SpikeNoiseSource. Defaults to [0, 0, 0], in which case the noisemaker will produce no spike noise.

reset()[source]

Reset NoiseMaker, by resetting all of its noise sources.

step(dt: float) → float[source]

Step the NoiseMaker forwards in time. All attached noise sources are stepp forwards, and then their outputs are summed to get the output from this noisemaker.

Parameters:

dt (float) – Interval of time to integrate the noise source over - not currently used.

Returns:

Output from noise source.

Return type:

float
